content.question: A circuit has two identical resistors, each with resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, a battery, and an inductor with inductance <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>, as shown. The switch is initially open and then switched to position <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>. It takes time <math alttext="t sub A" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> for the current in the inductor to reach <math alttext="63 percent" overflow="scroll"><mn>63</mn><mo>%</mo></math> of the steady-state current <math alttext="I sub s" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>s</mtext></msub></math>. After a long time, the switch is moved to position <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and it takes time <math alttext="t sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math> for the current in the inductor to reach <math alttext="37 percent" overflow="scroll"><mn>37</mn><mo>%</mo></math> of <math alttext="I sub s" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>s</mtext></msub></math>. The ratio <math alttext="the fraction t sub A over t sub B" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><msub><mi>t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></mfrac></math> is equal to

topic.text: 13.5: Circuits with Resistors and Inductors (LR Circuits)

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
